comments.author: brian@briansmith.org
comments.creator: brian@briansmith.org
comments.text:
From [1]: "Because DebugBreak is a call to a system function, system debug symbols must be installed to ensure the correct call stack information is displayed after breaking. Otherwise, the call stack information displayed by the debugger may be off by one frame. If you use __debugbreak, symbols are not required."


See also [2] about limitations of the DebugBreak()/__debugbreak() approach.

[1] http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ea9yy3ey.aspx
[2] http://www.codeproject.com/KB/debug/DebugBreakAnyway.aspx
comments.raw_text:
From [1]: "Because DebugBreak is a call to a system function, system debug symbols must be installed to ensure the correct call stack information is displayed after breaking. Otherwise, the call stack information displayed by the debugger may be off by one frame. If you use __debugbreak, symbols are not required."


See also [2] about limitations of the DebugBreak()/__debugbreak() approach.

[1] http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ea9yy3ey.aspx
[2] http://www.codeproject.com/KB/debug/DebugBreakAnyway.aspx
